title: Lunar Ice Mapping
summary: Mapping water ice deposits in permanently shadowed regions on the Moon.
details: Radar reflectometry and thermal imaging identify and quantify water ice at the lunar poles to guide landing site selection and resource utilization.

title: Lunar Habitat Materials
summary: Testing regolith-based construction materials for lunar habitats.
details: Researchers evaluate sintered regolith bricks and 3D-printed structures to reduce launch mass and enable sustainable lunar bases.

title: Radiation Shielding on Moon
summary: Assessing passive and active shielding concepts for long-duration lunar stays.
details: Comparative studies of polyethylene, regolith berms, and active magnetic shielding inform habitat design for crew safety.

title: Mars Dust Transport
summary: Studying dust lifting and transport mechanisms on Mars.
details: Simulations and lander/orbiter observations characterize seasonal dust storms and inform rover operations and climate models.

title: Water on Mars
summary: Evidence of past liquid water and subsurface ice reservoirs.
details: Geological mapping and isotope studies indicate ancient fluvial systems and localized subsurface ice deposits relevant for astrobiology and ISRU.

title: Mars Greenhouse Trials
summary: Testing plant growth under simulated Martian conditions.
details: Controlled-environment experiments assess plant resilience to low pressure, CO2-rich atmospheres, and Martian regolith simulants for bioregenerative life support.
